titleStmt.title: An elegy on the much-to-be-deplored death of that never-to-be-forgotten person, the Reverend Mr. Nathanael Collins who after he had been many years a faithful pastor to the Church at Middletown of Connecticut in New-England, about the forty third year of his age expired on 28th 10 moneth 1684.
titleStmt.author: Mather, Cotton, 1663-1728.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Pierce for Obadiah Gill,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: New York Public Library.
